item.description:
Mount Eisenhower is most often climbed by the Edmands Path and the Mount Eisenhower Loop [rt: 6.6 miles, 2,750 feet, 4:40] when done alone. The trail is never very steep, and the footing is good. This hike gives excellent views for a very reasonable effort, but remember that the summit is fully exposed to the weather.

 

Sunday

Partly cloudy with a chance of snow. Fog early. High of 7F with a windchill as low as -29F. Windy. Winds from the WNW at 35 to 50 mph with gusts to 60 mph. Chance of snow 20%.

 

PACK FOR COLD WEATHER   LAYERS  NO COTTON!!!

 

This trailhead gets closed in winter--so let's hike it now-It is an official 4000ft winter hike

 

'm just getting back onto the trails after a few months off- so this will be a casual, fun pace. Pack some warm clothes and traction, along with your essentials. I'm planning on us finishing by 4pm (sundown), but pack a headlamp anyway. Christmas cookies will be allowed on this hike.

 

Mt. Eisenhower by Edmunds Path 6.6 2,750 4:40

THIS HIKE IS WEATHER SENSITIVE- PLEASE WATCH THE WEATHER AND FOR ANY CHANGES-

 

For those of us that are less fit, hiking is fantastic conditioning, but that stress level is hit much faster so replacement drinks are advised. Nuun, Powerade Zero, and Gatorade all make a good sugar free version for those who are controlling their sugar.



Click for weather forecast

 

ALL CANCELLATIONS OR CHANGES TO RSVP'S SHOULD BE MADE BY 6 PM THE NIGHT BEFORE THE HIKE. We rely of the RSVP's to get a true headcount and the hikers rely on the leaders to communicate.
item.how_to_find_us: 8:30 am Edmonds trailhead on Clinton road Not the Eisenhower trailhead unless they close the road for the winter
item.name: Mt Eisenhower XMAS Casual paced
